maml:description.maml:para: Creates an Exchange Web Services connection using the EWS API 2.2

Creates an Exchange Web Services connction using the EWS API 2.2. The UserPrincipalName/UserName is assumed to be the email address unless the EmailAddress parameter is specified for the AutoDiscover lookup. Alternatively, an EWS endpoint can be supplied to entirely bypass the Autodiscover process (which is significantly faster).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the credential to use to connect to EWS supplied as a PSCredential .
The version of Exchange server to which to connect. Default is Exchange2013_SP1 and works with Exchange Online and newer versions of Exchange server.
Specifies the EWS Endpoint to use in order to bypass the Autodiscover process as an Uri .
Specifies the credential to use to connect to EWS supplied as a PSCredential .
Specifies the email address to use for AutoDiscover lookups supplied as a MailAddress .
The version of Exchange server to which to connect. Default is Exchange2013_SP1 and works with Exchange Online and newer versions of Exchange server.
Specifies the credential to use to connect to EWS supplied as a PSCredential .
The version of Exchange server to which to connect. Default is Exchange2013_SP1 and works with Exchange Online and newer versions of Exchange server.
Specifies the username, commonly in the format of UserPrincipalName, but can also be in the Netbios format <Domain>\<SamAccountName> (for Exchange Server on-premises, only).
Specifies the email address to use for AutoDiscover lookups supplied as a MailAddress .
Specifies a password supplied as a SecureString .
The version of Exchange server to which to connect. Default is Exchange2013_SP1 and works with Exchange Online and newer versions of Exchange server.
Specifies the username, commonly in the format of UserPrincipalName, but can also be in the Netbios format <Domain>\<SamAccountName> (for Exchange Server on-premises, only).
Specifies a password supplied as a SecureString .
The version of Exchange server to which to connect. Default is Exchange2013_SP1 and works with Exchange Online and newer versions of Exchange server.
Specifies the username, commonly in the format of UserPrincipalName, but can also be in the Netbios format <Domain>\<SamAccountName> (for Exchange Server on-premises, only).
Specifies a password supplied as a SecureString .
The version of Exchange server to which to connect. Default is Exchange2013_SP1 and works with Exchange Online and newer versions of Exchange server.
Specifies the EWS Endpoint to use in order to bypass the Autodiscover process as an Uri .
Specifies the credential to use to connect to EWS supplied as a PSCredential .
Specifies the email address to use for AutoDiscover lookups supplied as a MailAddress .
Specifies a password supplied as a SecureString .
Specifies the username, commonly in the format of UserPrincipalName, but can also be in the Netbios format <Domain>\<SamAccountName> (for Exchange Server on-premises, only).
The version of Exchange server to which to connect. Default is Exchange2013_SP1 and works with Exchange Online and newer versions of Exchange server.
Specifies the EWS Endpoint to use in order to bypass the Autodiscover process as an Uri .

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Connect-Ews -Credential $PSCredential
KeepAlive Url ImpersonatedUserId --------- --- ------------------ True https://outlook.office365.com/EWS/Exchange.asmx

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an Exchange Web Services connection using the supplied PSCredential . The PSCredential can be created like $PSCredential = Get-Credential and entering the credentials in the prompt.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Connect-Ews -Credential $PSCredential -Endpoint https://mail.contoso.com/EWS/Exchange.asmx
KeepAlive Url ImpersonatedUserId --------- --- ------------------ True https://mail.contoso.com/EWS/Exchange.asmx

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates and Exchange Web Services connection using the supplied PSCredential and Uri for the endpoint.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a the child folders of the specified folder object.

Returns the child folders of the specified folder object. It defaults to 1000 total child folders, but that can be modified with the FolderView parameter. Utilizes the FindFolders method of the ExchangeService and only uses the Shallow depth of the Traversal property, as opposed to the Deep depth which would grab all subfolders.
This is depended on by the Get-EwsFolder cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Supplies the parent folder to find the child folders. Should be of type Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.Folder or Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.WellKnownFolderName .
Provides the maximum number of folders to return.
Optionally, specifies an ExchangeService object.
Supplies the parent folder to find the child folders. Should be of type Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.Folder or Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.WellKnownFolderName .
Provides the maximum number of folders to return.
Optionally, specifies an ExchangeService object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-EwsChildItem -Folder Inbox
FolderClass DisplayName TotalCount UnreadCount ----------- ----------- ---------- ----------- IPF.Note Subfolder 1 1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Lists the subfolders of the Inbox folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a single folder object, given a folder or folder path
Returns a single folder object, given a folder or folder path, that can be used to get folder items or perform other tasks.

maml:Description.maml:para: The hierarchical path to a leaf folder
Provide a WellKnownFolderName to start as the root of the hierarchy.
Optionally, specifies an ExchangeService object.
The hierarchical path to a leaf folder
Optionally, specifies an ExchangeService object.
Provide a WellKnownFolderName to start as the root of the hierarchy.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $Folder = Get-EwsFolder -FolderPath Inbox\Subfolder PS C:\> $Folder

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the ~Subfolder~ folder from within the ~Inbox~.

maml:description.maml:para: Getss items from the specified folder and allows for various filtering criteria, including start and end dates, first or last number of items, skip items for paging, and exclude item details (like the item body) to improve the speed.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.Folder to search. Can be set with the Get-EwsWellKnownFolder cmdlet.
Used to limit criteria to items before specified date
Specifies to get the last N items from the folder.
Specifies to not get the details of the item, such as the Body , but at a significant speed improvement. The Id properties can then be passed to the Get-EwsItem cmdlet to get the details.
Optionally, specifies an ExchangeService object.
Specifies N items to skip, which can be used to page through additional items on subsequent executions.
Used to limit criteria to items after specified date
Specifies the Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.Folder to search. Can be set with the Get-EwsWellKnownFolder cmdlet.
Used to limit criteria to items before specified date
Specifies to not get the details of the item, such as the Body , but at a significant speed improvement. The Id properties can then be passed to the Get-EwsItem cmdlet to get the details.
Limits results to the first N items. The default value is 10, but up to 1000 items can be retrieved at once.
Optionally, specifies an ExchangeService object.
Specifies N items to skip, which can be used to page through additional items on subsequent executions.
Used to limit criteria to items after specified date
Used to limit criteria to items before specified date
Specifies the Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.Folder to search. Can be set with the Get-EwsWellKnownFolder cmdlet.
Specifies to get the last N items from the folder.
Specifies to not get the details of the item, such as the Body , but at a significant speed improvement. The Id properties can then be passed to the Get-EwsItem cmdlet to get the details.
Limits results to the first N items. The default value is 10, but up to 1000 items can be retrieved at once.
Optionally, specifies an ExchangeService object.
Specifies N items to skip, which can be used to page through additional items on subsequent executions.
Used to limit criteria to items after specified date

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-EwsFolderItem -Folder $Folder -First 2
From Sent Subject ---- ------------ ------- Service <SMTP:service@tailspintoys.com> 8/16/2018 8:49:09 PM Unimportant message from the Service BigBoss <SMTP:boss@contoso.com> 8/16/2018 8:47:19 PM Urgent message from the boss

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the first two messages from the specified folder. The Folder can be specific with the Get-EwsWellKnownFolder cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the object of a well known folder in an Exchange mailbox.
Get the object of a well known folder in an Exchange mailbox, such as the Inbox, Sent Items, Deleted Items, etc.

maml:Description.maml:para: Supply a Folder object. Can be tab completed as it uses the type accelerator. Only valid well known folders can be passed.
Optionally, specifies an ExchangeService object to set the impersonation mailbox.
Supply a Folder object. Can be tab completed as it uses the type accelerator. Only valid well known folders can be passed.
Optionally, specifies an ExchangeService object to set the impersonation mailbox.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-EwsWellKnownFolder -FolderName Inbox
FolderClass DisplayName TotalCount UnreadCount ----------- ----------- ---------- ----------- IPF.Note Inbox 76496 60099

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the Inbox folder within the Exchange mailbox.

maml:description.maml:para: Moves or copies an item to the specified target folder.
Moves or copies an item to the specified target folder, with a default action of move.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the item(s) which to move/copy.
Specifies the target folder of type Folder .
Specifies whether to move or copy the item(s).
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the item(s) which to move/copy.
Specifies whether to move or copy the item(s).
Specifies the target folder of type Folder .
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Move-EwsItem -Item $Item -TargetFolder $Folder
Are you sure that you want to move the item? Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.EmailMessage [Y] Yes [A] Yes to All [N] No [L] No to All [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"):

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Move-EwsItem -Item $Item -TargetFolder $Folder -MoveType Copy
Are you sure that you want to copy the item? Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.EmailMessage [Y] Yes [A] Yes to All [N] No [L] No to All [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"):

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the specified item(s) from the mailbox, moving the item to the Deleted Items folder, by default.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the item(s) which to delete.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the delete mode:

MoveToDeletedItems: moves the item to the Deleted Items folder SoftDelete: deletes the item and places it in the Recoverable Items folder HardDelete: permanently deletes the item, unless a hold mechanism is in place.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the item(s) which to delete.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies the delete mode:

MoveToDeletedItems: moves the item to the Deleted Items folder SoftDelete: deletes the item and places it in the Recoverable Items folder HardDelete: permanently deletes the item, unless a hold mechanism is in place.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Moves the specified item to the Deleted Items folder.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Remove-EwsItem -Item $Item -DeleteMode SoftDelete
Are you sure that you want to SoftDelete the item? Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.EmailMessage [Y] Yes [A] Yes to All [N] No [L] No to All [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"):

dev:remarks.maml:para: Deletes the specified item, but it is retained the the Recoverable Items folder.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Remove-EwsItem -Item $Item -DeleteMode HardDelete
Are you sure that you want to HardDelete the item? Microsoft.Exchange.WebServices.Data.EmailMessage [Y] Yes [A] Yes to All [N] No [L] No to All [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"):

dev:remarks.maml:para: Deletes the specified item in an unrecoverable method, without a hold mechanism in place.

maml:description.maml:para: Sends a message as the signed in account.
Sends a message as the signed in account.

maml:Description.maml:para: The recipient(s) of the message.
The subject of the message.
The body of the email message.
The file attachment to send.
Specifies the body type, either Text (default) or HTML.
Do not place the item in the Sent Items folder.
Optionally, specifies an ExchangeService object to set the impersonation mailbox.
The body of the email message.
The file attachment to send.
The subject of the message.
The recipient(s) of the message.
Specifies the body type, either Text (default) or HTML.
Do not place the item in the Sent Items folder.
Optionally, specifies an ExchangeService object to set the impersonation mailbox.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Send-EwsMessage -To user@contoso.com -Subject 'EWS Message from Me' -Body 'Message here'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sends a message to user@contoso.com as the authenticated user.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Send-EwsMessage -To user@contoso.com -Subject 'EWS Message from Me' -Body 'Message here' -Service $ImpersonatedService

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sends a message to user@contoso.com as the Impersonated Account.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Send-EwsMessage -To user@contoso.com -Subject 'EWS Message from Me' -Body 'Message here' -DoNotKeep

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sends a message to user@contoso.com as the authenticated user and does not keep it in the Sent Items folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Set which mailbox to access via Application Impersonation rights (requires rights already established).

Set which mailbox to access via Application Impersonation rights. Use the <MailAddress> with the Connect-Ews cmdlet when the identity associated with the authentication credentials has no assigned mailbox prior to running Set-EwsImpersonationMailbox . Can be used to set the default service or any saved service object.

maml:Description.maml:para: Provide a valid recipient address for an Exchange mailbox to which Application Impersonation rights have been granted.
Optionally, specifies an ExchangeService object to set the impersonation mailbox.
Provide a valid recipient address for an Exchange mailbox to which Application Impersonation rights have been granted.
Optionally, specifies an ExchangeService object to set the impersonation mailbox.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Set-EwsImpersonationMailbox -EmailAddress $MailAddress
KeepAlive Url ImpersonatedUserId --------- --- ------------------ True https://outlook.office365.com/EWS/Exchange.asmx user@contoso.com

dev:remarks.maml:para: In the default ExchangeService, set the ImperonatedUserId in the EWS Managed API for the service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Set-EwsImpersonationMailbox -EmailAddress $MailAddress -Service $Service
KeepAlive Url ImpersonatedUserId --------- --- ------------------ True https://outlook.office365.com/EWS/Exchange.asmx user@contoso.com

dev:remarks.maml:para: In the $Service ExchangeService object, set the ImperonatedUserId in the EWS Managed API for the service.
